title: Battle of Tours
summary: The Battle of Tours,[6] also called the Battle of Poitiers and, by Arab sources, the Battle of the Highway of the Martyrs (Arabic: معركة بلاط الشهداء‎, romanized: Maʿrakat Balāṭ ash-Shuhadā'),[7] was fought on 10 October 732, and was an important battle during the Umayyad invasion of Gaul. It resulted in the victory for the Frankish and Aquitainian forces,[8][9] led by Charles Martel, over the invading forces of the Umayyad Caliphate, led by Abdul Rahman Al Ghafiqi, governor of al-Andalus.
